@skookull1 My brother-in-law Joe, long time professor at Johns Hopkins, grew up in the next town over from me in New Jersey in one of those Italian-American families. He seldom eats a tomato that he didn't grow himself.

@skookull1 I grew up on a small farm in New Jersey in 1950's & early 60's. We had cows, sheep, chickens, dozen fruit trees & lots of tomatoes. On our street lived several older immigrants from Italy. You know they took tomato gardening seriously.
